original: Erasmie, Gottsclialk Johan Olof, di-striktsilantmätare, Skara, f. 16/3/06 i Herrljunga, Älvsb. 1., av postassist. Ivar E. o. Anna Ekelund. G. 30 m. Marigarete Benter. Barn: Kerstin f. 33, Bengt 37, Torsten 40, Carl-Otto 41. — Studiex. i Skara 24, lantmät :ex. 28, kultur tekn. kurs 33. E. lantmät. i Kalm. 1. 28-32, i Upps. 1. 33-35, assls-t. å lantmät :kont. i Järn ti. 1. 35-36, e. lantmät. o. tf. distr rlantmät. i Jämtl. 1. 37-39, distr :lantmät. i Ströms distr. 39-46, mätn:man i Strömsunds .muni-c:samh. 40-46, distr rlantmät. i Skara distr. fr. 46 o. mätn:man i Kvänum’S 0. Lundisbrunns munic :samh. fr. 47. Led. av Strömsunds munic :fullm. 42-46, ordf. i hyresnd där 44.
translated: Erasmie, Gottschalk Johan Olof, district surveyor, from Skara, born March 16, 1906 in Herrljunga, Älvsborg county, son of post office assistant Ivar E. and Anna Ekelund. Married to Marigarete Benter in 1930. They have four children: Kerstin (born 1933), Bengt (born 1937), Torsten (born 1940), and Carl-Otto (born 1941). Erasmie graduated from Skara with a bachelor's degree in 1924, received his land surveyor's certification in 1928, and took a cultural technology course in 1933. His career includes surveyor positions in Kalmar county (1928-1932), Uppsala county (1933-1935), and Jämtland county (1937-1939), and as district surveyor in Ströms district (1939-1946) and Skara district (from 1946). Erasmie was also a member of the Strömsund municipal council from 1942-1946, and served as chairman of the housing committee from 1944. Since 1947, he has been a surveyor in Kvänum and Lundbybrunn municipal associations.

structured.name: Gottsclialk Johan Olof Erasmie
structured.description: Gottsclialk Johan Olof Erasmie was a Swedish district surveyor born on March 16, 1906, in Herrljunga, Älvsborg county. He was the son of post office assistant Ivar E. and Anna Ekelund. He married Marigarete Benter in 1930, and they had four children. Erasmie graduated from Skara with a bachelor's degree in 1924 and later received his land surveyor's certification in 1928 and took a cultural technology course in 1933. He worked as a surveyor in several counties and districts in Sweden, including Kalmar, Uppsala, Jämtland, Ströms, and Skara. He was a member of the Strömsund municipal council from 1942-1946 and served as chairman of the housing committee in 1944. Since 1947, he has been a surveyor in Kvänum and Lundbybrunn municipal associations.
